The claim that the lab in Wuhan was fund: 3,800,000 is false. The money referenced was actually provided to a U.S. research group, EcoHealth Alliance.
Only: 600,000 of the grant went to the Wuhan Institute of Virology, which was a collaborator on the project and the funding was pre-approved by the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and the State Department.
The: 3.8 million figure mentioned in the claim actually refers to a $3.4 million grant awarded by NIH to EcoHealth Alliance in 2014. This grant was meant for studying the risk of future emergence of coronaviruses from bats.
The grant was renewed in 2019 for anothe: but it was terminated by NIH in April. President Donald Trump had also made an unsupported claim that the amount received by the Wuhan lab was even higher ($7.5 million), but the portion that went to the lab was only $600,000.
